name: deimosrising
text: This strip's prose is absolutely gorgeous. Chris you're a genius dogg

text: Aye. 'In a land ravaged by terror'

text: I agree. He nailed Coupland, to the point where I feel like if Coupland himself read this he might burst into tears.

text: It's also extra-funny considering how much Michael Chabon's novel The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier and Clay ripped off E.L. Doctorow's novel Ragtime .

text: 5 for Coupland's ellipses

text: So apparently I'm the only person here who has no idea who Douglas Coupland or Michael Chabon are.

text: Correct. Go forth to your local library.

name: gmm
text: Two of my favourite writers. And lo, Onstad does a very good impression of both.

text: I don't either. But Achewood has helped introduce me to many new intrigues...these writers won't be the first, nor will they be the last.

text: Somewhere, lucifer steeples his fingers...and waits.

name: lux
text: lucifer enjoys verbal irony the most out of all the ironies.

text: In the frozen desserts section at Whole Foods, apparently.

name: josearcadio
text: haha michael chabon lol

name: l_c_b
text: It's always great when Onstad does his "impressions" of writers. The Chabon bit is more Chabon...um...Chabon-ariffic than Chabon himself.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
This kind of reminds of when music critics try to make it sound like a new Justin Timberlake album is one of the top 10 albums of the year.

Hey, you can like the guy if you want, but his album cannot be important.

name: farqussus
text:
why not? he might actually have talent.


he might!

name: woodenteeth
text: Justin Timberlake has bucketloads of talent, and he vomits it into a funnel that dribbles it into production line Music-In-A-Can. The product is confusingly well made but entirely without nutrition.

name: tekende
text: This is astute. However guilty I may feel about it, I do very much enjoy Future Sex Love Sounds.

name: tekende
text: Also, anyone who thinks Justin Timberlake doesn't possess talent needs to watch the Youtube videos him hosting the Espy awards. Shit is so cash .

name: fineoakstructure
text:
oh JESUS CHRIST you kids today (I'm looking at you, farq and wt). There's probably 20 kids in every town across the US of A who can sing and dance like that mama's boy. It's talent, sure, but not unique talent. He's a pretty boy who can dance, charm, and choose actual talented people to help make his music.

He is the male Madonna.

Like I said, that doesn't mean the music can't be enjoyed, but if your artistic raison d'etre is to "bring the sexxy back," then, no, you're not important.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Dear FOS,

1) No one here was arguing that he's important. 2) I agree and share your ire. 3) Future of the Left is a more than satisfying replacement for McClusky.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yeah, it was more of a "rant to the general public" and to that one person who lamed me 5 months ago.

name: woodenteeth
text: Hilarious, I just realised, after reading your original comment that this whole thread stemmed from farq debating your "important" debate with a "talent" comment. As you were.

name: farqussus
text: Conceded, talent and importance can be mutually exclusive

name: tekende
text: I have talent but I am totally not important.

name: rowboat
text: I am hugely important but have little or no talent.

name: tekende
text: I didn't say it was unique. I didn't say it was art. Just, he has talent. Loads of it. Could it be better used? Sure. But it's there.

name: tripleg
text: i, for one, certainly look forward to the amazing come-back album that is sure to follow his inevitable fall from grace

name: nek314
text: It's silly to like Justin Timberlake! Really, you shouldn't like Justin Timberlake.

name: troy_convers
text: Try reading the text in your mind in the style of James Earl Jones (especially the Time review)...INTENSE!!!

name: nice-on-water
text: Who asked Chabon?
